form.name: form1

span.p:
In observance of the state-mandated school closure order, Danbury School will close and transition to our Remote Instruction Plan beginning on Monday, March 16th through Friday, May 1st.
Please see http://bit.ly/DanburyCOVID19 for details and updates. Thank you and stay healthy!

span.div: We are seeking well-qualified applicants to join the Danbury family for the 2020-21 school year. We have several opportunities available for skilled, caring, dedicated professionals to join our staff including teaching and administrative positions. Please see the employment page on our website for details and application instructions.
Please see http://bit.ly/DanburyCOVID19 for information regarding our ongoing operations under the current stay-at-home order & school building closures.

Starting with next week's student meal pick up on Monday, April 13th, please remember to fill out the survey by Thursday at 10:00a.m. for EACH student in your household every week. Each individual student will receive five (5) different breakfast and five (5) different lunch meals. Follow the link for the survey here: https://forms.gle/WZpU8hDiYuAdPmW5A
Meal pickup will take place every Monday from 6-7pm located at the Athletic lobby doors!
Do you have questions for us regarding the meal pick-up process or household eligibility to participate? Feel free to call us at 419-798-5185 ext. 1022!!
Stay healthy! See you on Monday!

span.span: Due to social distancing requirements and stay-at-home orders in response to the COVID-19 pandemic, the Danbury Board of Education will transition to online meetings via Google Meet video conferencing. This change will commence with the Special Session scheduled for Thursday, April 9th at 4:00pm.

div.span: In compliance with public meeting regulations and guidance from the State of Ohio, the public is welcome to view the live video stream of these meetings. A link to the live feed for each meeting will be posted on this page:
before the scheduled start of each meeting. More details regarding access and technical support are available at the link as well.
The purpose of the April 9th meeting is for the board to approve the resolution around electronic meetings. In addition, the board will discuss future potential commencement ceremony dates.

span.div: This morning we experienced intermittent outages for at least two of our commonly used websites: Schoology and Seesaw. Unfortunately, this is something that all of us should be braced for as the whole world dramatically increases usage of online learning and remote work. We will all do our best to remain flexible and adapt to our changing environment as we work through this situation together. Teachers and school staff know the challenges we're all facing right now and have set their expectations accordingly.

In an effort to improve our communication on this topic, we have started collecting links to the status pages of our most commonly used online resources. If you're having trouble accessing something, please check this page first to see if there is an outage for that site.

span.strong: Danbury Local Schools will instill within each student a drive for personal excellence, lifelong learning, and a distinct set of core values that positively impact family and community.
